intro: Arabis scopoliana, commonly known as the rock白菜 or scopolian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. Arabis scopoliana is often found in alpine environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in garden settings.
